solution-article.title: Installing Follow You Printing or other Campus Network Printers
solution-article.description:
Title:
Installing Follow You Printing and Any other Campus Network Printers

Summary:

MSOE has many network printers on campus, including the ubiquitous Follow You Printing, that can easily be installed and printed to. This printers are available via the two printer servers printers.msoe.edu and officeprinters.msoe.edu


Solution:

Ensure the laptop is connected to the MSOE network. Open the Start menu, type Run and press the Enter key. Type \\printers.ad.msoe.edu (if you wish to install follow you printing) and press the Enter key. A window will open listing all of the network printers available. Double click on the desired printer in order to install it.
If a window pops up asking for a login, type your username in as AD\username and then your MSOE password.
If you wish to install a department or office printer you will need to enter \\officeprinters.ad.msoe.edu into the run prompt and select the desired printer.
* Please note you must be on the MSOE or MSOEcert wifi networks to print and

In the case of Follow You Printing, the option with spaces, Follow You Printing, is the printer for Windows laptops and the option without spaces, FollowYouPrinting, is the option for Mac laptops.


Updated: 2/21/2018

solution-article.title: Installing MSOE Printers on Ubuntu Linux 17.04
solution-article.description:
Title:
Installing MSOE Printers on Ubuntu Linux 17.04

Summary:

Installing MSOE printers on Linux is a somewhat more involved process, but still easily done.


Solution:

Ensure the laptop is connected to the MSOE network. Launch the Printers settings application from the apps menu. Click on the Add button. Under Devices, select Network Printer, and then Windows Printer via SAMBA. In the smb:// field, type printers.ad.msoe.edu/. Click on the Browse button, and when prompted input the following information:

Username: This is any valid MSOE username
Domain: ad
Password: This is the password for the username

Select the printer that is to be installed. Click on the OK button, and then on the Forward button. If prompted to install python-smb or smbclient, install them. Select PCL 6 and click on the Forward button. Give the printer a name and description, and click on the Apply button. The printer should now be installed and ready for use.


Updated: 2/21/2018

solution-article.title: Manually Installing a Printer That Is Plugged In to the Network
solution-article.description:
Title:
Manually Installing a Printer That is Plugged In to the Network

Summary:

Some personal or department printers may be plugged in to the MSOE network but not shared over it, and will need to be installed manually.


Solution:

Ensure that the laptop is connected to the MSOE network. Find the IP address of the printer. This can be found by printing the network settings page off of the printer. This can be done by going into the settings on the printer and finding something along the lines of "Network Configuration Page". Each printer is different, so to avoid having to hunt through all of the settings a Google search for "Network Configuration Page [printer model]" will usually help.

On the computer, navigate to Devices and Printers. This is found by going to the Control Panel, clicking Hardware and Sound, and clicking Devices and Printers. Click Add a Printer. Click The Printer That I Want Isn't Listed. Check Add a printer using a TCP/IP address or hostname, then click next. Fill out Hostname or IP address with the address found off of the Network Configuration page. The Port name should automatically populate with the same address; leave this as is. Ensure that Query the Printer and Automatically Select the Driver to Use is checked and hit next.

If prompted for a driver, the driver that needs to be installed will have the same name as the model type of the printer, which can also be found on the Network Configuration page. If you do not see the correct driver in the list, click the Windows Update button to update the list. Select the correct driver and hit next.

Give the printer a name and hit next. The printer should now be available for use.


Updated: 2/21/2018

solution-article.title: Receiving the Error \\Printers or \\officeprinters is Not Accessible
solution-article.description:
Title:
Receiving the Error \\Printers or \\officeprinters is Not Accessible

Summary:

Occasionally when attempting to print, an error may pop up that \\Printers or \\officeprinters is not accessible. This occurs due to out-of-date credentials being used to attempt to connect to the printer server.


Solution:

Open the Start menu, type Run and press the Enter key. Type Control and press the Enter key. Click on User Accounts, and then Credential Manager. Click on the Windows Credentials button and remove all cached credentials for printers and *sessions under the Windows Credentials section.


Updated: 7/31/2018

Solution: Open the Start menu, type Run and press the Enter key. Type Control and press the Enter key. Click on User Accounts, and then Credential Manager. Click on the Windows Credentials button and remove all cached credentials for printers and *sessions under the Windows Credentials section. Updated: 7/31/2018

solution-article.title: Stapling on Follow You Printing
solution-article.description:
Title:
Stapling on Follow You Printing

Summary:

Many MSOE printers connected to Follow You Printing have the capability to staple the documents that they are printing.


Solution:

Open the Control Panel. Select Hardware and Sound. Click on Devices and Printers. Right click on Follow You Printing. Select Printer Preferences.


On the My Tab tab, check the staple box. Hit Apply, then OK.


This will default to staple any jobs with more than 1 page.

Updated: 2/21/2018

On the My Tab tab, check the staple box. Hit Apply, then OK.
This will default to staple any jobs with more than 1 page.
Updated: 2/21/2018

solution-article.title: Installing Follow You Printing on Mac 10.9 or Newer
solution-article.description:
Title:
Installing Follow You Printing on Mac 10.9 or Newer

Summary:

Setting up Follow You Printing on a Mac device is a bit more involved, but still simple to do.


Solution:

Navigate to System Preferences -> Print and Scan. Click the + button to add a new printer. Control-Click on the Toolbar and select Customize Toolbar.... Drag the Advanced icon onto the bar, then click the newly added Advanced button. Select the Windows printer via spoolss device type.

Enter a Device URL. Mac OS 10.9, 10.10, and 10.11 are confirmed to work with the syntax as follows, this may work with all OS’es that define the printer type as “Windows printer via spoolss”. Make sure that there are no spaces after the syntax if you copy and paste from this document.

smb://printers.ad.msoe.edu/FollowYouPrinting




The Name field will automatically fill with “printers.ad.msoe.edu” if it recognizes the syntax. Choose a driver for this printer by pulling down the drop-down box and selecting Generic PCL Printer. Click the Add button.


Open a document and print. Select “printers.ad.msoe.edu” as the printer. When going to print it will require authorization that can be saved to the “keychain” which should allow printing with one click once it is saved. Users will need to enter their domain UN and PW. By saving this to the “keychain”, it is necessary to manually update it every time you change your domain UN and PW.


Updated: 2/21/18

solution-article.title: Any Browser - Deleting Saved Credentials
solution-article.description:
Title:
Any Browser - Deleting Saved Credentials

Summary:
After a password change, an online resource may become inaccessible due to the browser storing out-of-date credentials.

Solution:
The steps taken will depend on the browser being used.


For Google Chrome:

Click on the button on the top right that looks like three dots, and then click on Settings. Scroll down to the bottom of the page and click on Advanced. Under the second section, Passwords and Forms, click on Manage Passwords. In the Saved Passwords section, click on a website and click Delete in order to delete the saved credential for that site. Click on the Done button when finished.


For Mozilla Firefox:

Click on the button on the top right that looks like three lines, and then click on Options. Open the Privacy and Security tab and click on the Saved Logins... button. Click on a website and click the Remove button in order to delete the saved credential for that site. Click on the Close button when finished.


For Internet Explorer:

In the search bar, start typing the username of the credential to be deleted. In the auto-complete dropdown, the credential will eventually appear. Click on the X button on the right side of the dropdown to delete the credentials.

Updated: 2/22/2018

solution-article.title: Any Browser - Issues with Crashing When Printing to Follow you Printing
solution-article.description:
Title:
Any Browser - Issues with Crashing When Printing to Follow You Printing

Summary:
An incorrect or out-of-date printer driver can cause the browser to crash when attempting to print to the printer.

Solution:
This issue can usually be resolved by going into Software Center and installing Follow You Printing. This reinstall should update the printer driver version.

If that does not resolve the issue, then open the Start menu, type Printers and press the Enter key. In the window that opens, scroll to the bottom and click on Devices and Printers. Under printers, right click on all currently installed versions of Follow You Printing and click on Remove Device. Click on the Yes button on the popup that asks if you are sure.

Open the Start menu, type Services and press the Enter key. In the window that opens, find Print Spooler, right click on it and click Restart.

Open the Start menu, type Print Management and press the Enter key. In the window that opens, on the left side expand Print Servers, and then expand the server that includes (local) in the name. Click on Drivers. Right click on the driver KONICA MINOLTA C52SeriesPCL and click Remove Driver Package.

Open the Start menu, type Services and press the Enter key. In the window that opens, find Print Spooler, right click on it and click Restart for a second time.

Attempt to reinstall Follow You Printing from Software Center.

Updated: 2/22/2018

Click on Drivers. Right click on the driver KONICA MINOLTA C52SeriesPCL and click Remove Driver Package. Open the Start menu, type Services and press the Enter key. In the window that opens, find Print Spooler, right click on it and click Restart for a second time. Attempt to reinstall Follow You Printing from Software Center. Updated: 2/22/2018

solution-article.title: Aurora Health Care - Connecting to Aurora's Training Environment
solution-article.description:
Title:
Aurora Health Care - Connecting to Aurora's Training Environment

Summary:
Nursing students have access to a testing environment provided by Aurora Health Care.

Solution:

Open File Explorer and navigate to M:\Aurora Training Environment\. Run the CitrixOnlinePluginWeb.exe installation file in that folder.


Once the installation is complete, open Internet Explorer and navigate to the https://remote.aurora.org website. When prompted, use one of the following accounts for access. If the account is in use, cancel the connection and use another.


Usernames      Passwords

msoetrn001     TeachMe001

msoetrn002     TeachMe002

msoetrn003     TeachMe003

msoetrn004     TeachMe004

msoetrn005     TeachMe005

msoetrn006     TeachMe006

msoetrn007     TeachMe007

msoetrn008     TeachMe008

msoetrn009     TeachMe009

msoetrn010     TeachMe010

MSOETRN011  TeachMe011

MSOETRN012  TeachMe012

MSOETRN013  TeachMe013

MSOETRN014  TeachMe014

MSOETRN015  TeachMe015


Once logged in, choose Clinical Citrix Applications. If the site requests a XenApp install, agree to the licensing agreement and install. The Aurora Training Environment applications should now be available.

Updated: 2/28/2018

solution-article.title: BitDefender - Unable to Save to Documents
solution-article.description:
Title:

BitDefender - Unable to Save Documents

Summary:
BitDefender has a feature to protect files and folders on the computer that it is installed on. If only certain programs are unable to save files to a location, then it is possible that BitDefender is blocking the programs.

Solution:

Open BitDefender. On the Home page, click on Advanced. Select File Protection, and allow any blocked programs that should be allowed to save files to the protected location.

Updated: 3/1/2018

Select File Protection, and allow any blocked programs that should be allowed to save files to the protected location. Updated: 3/1/2018

solution-article.title: Box - Logging In With an Android or Apple Device
solution-article.description:
Title:
Box - Logging In With an Android or Apple Device

Summary:
When logging in to an MSOE Box account on an Android or Apple device, it is necessary to log in with Single Sign-On.

Solution:

Download the free Box app from the app store. Open the app, and at the bottom of the log in screen press My Company Uses Single Sign-On for Android, or More Login Options for Apple. Enter an MSOE email address and press Continue.

MSOE's Single Sign-On page will then open. Enter the same email address and password, and press Sign In.

solution-article.title: Google Chrome - Touch Screen Not Working
solution-article.description:
Title:
Google Chrome - Touch Screen Not Working

Summary:
If a laptop's touch screen stops functioning only in Google Chrome, then it is possible that the touch screen is not being automatically detected.

Solution:

In Google Chrome, head to chrome://flags in the address bar. Find Touch Events API and select Enable instead of Automatic. Restart Google Chrome, and the touch screen should work.

Updated: 2/28/2018

solution-article.title: Microsoft Office 2016 - Common Issues
solution-article.description:
Title:

Microsoft Office 2016 - Common Issues

Summary:
When a Microsoft Office product, such as Word, Outlook, PowerPoint, OneNote or Excel, is malfunctioning, an easy troubleshooting step is to run the built-in repair function.

Solution:

Open the Start menu, type Add or Remove Programs and press the Enter key. In the window that opens, scroll to the bottom and click on Programs and Features. In the window that opens, find Microsoft Professional Plus 2016 or Microsoft Office 365 ProPlus. Select the program, and click on the Change button at the top of the list. Follow the instructions on the window that opens to run through the repair wizard.

Updated: 2/28/2018

solution-article.title: Microsoft Office 2016 - Encrypting Documents
solution-article.description:
Title:

Microsoft Office 2016 - Encrypting Documents

Summary:

Microsoft Office allows the functionality of encrypting documents, in order to add additional security to sensitive documents.


Solution:

In any Microsoft Office application, go to the File menu and open the Info tab. Click the Protect Document dropdown button and choose the desired type of security for the document.

solution-article.title: Microsoft Office 2016 - Autosave Recovery
solution-article.description:
Title:

Microsoft Office 2016 - Autosave Recovery

Summary:
While editing a document, Microsoft Office will automatically save autosave recovery documents at regular intervals, by default every ten minutes.

Solution:

The autosave files can be found by default at the following locations:


C:\Users\<username>\AppData\Roaming\Microsoft\Word - This is used for files that were saved at one point but were closed without saving new changes


C:\Users\<username>\AppData\Local\Microsoft\Office\UnsavedFiles - This is used for files that were never saved in the first place.


In order to open an autosave file for a file that was never saved, do the following:


Open the Office app for the file you are looking for (Word, Excel, etc.), and open a new blank document. Click on File in the top corner. From the Info tab, click on the Manage Document drop down, and click on Recover Unsaved Documents.



This will open the file view to where these autosave files are saved. Open any files listed to see if they are the ones you are looking for.


In order to open an autosave file for a file that was saved but new changes were lost:


Open the last version of the file that you are looking for. Click on File in the top corner. From the Info tab, next to the Manage Document drop down, the most recent autosave file will be listed. Click on it in order to open the file.



Alternatively, click on the Manage Document drop down, and click on Recover Unsaved Documents. From here, navigate to where the autosave files are located on your device (default at C:\Users\<username>\AppData\Roaming\Microsoft\Word). There will be listed a group of folders holding autosave files. The folder you want will start with the name of the file, followed by some numbers. Open any files listed to see if they are the ones you are looking for.


In order to change the settings for where and how often autosave files are created:


Open a document. Click on File in the top corner. Click on Options on the left. From the Save tab, you can change the frequency of file saves and the default location they are saved to.



Updated: 3/1/2018

solution-article.title: Microsoft Word 2016 - Not Responding on Windows 10
solution-article.description:
Title:

Microsoft Word 2016 - Not Responding on Windows 10

Summary:
The Box Add-in to Word 2016 is known to have a habit of causing Word to crash. Disabling the add-in can cause these crashes to stop occurring.

Solution:

In a Word file, click on File and then on Options. In the window that opens, click on Add-ins. At the bottom of the page, under the Manage drop down, select COM Add-ins and click the Go... button. In the window that opens, uncheck the Box add-in and press the OK button. Restart Word.

Updated: 3/1/2018

At the bottom of the page, under the Manage drop down, select COM Add-ins and click the Go... button. In the window that opens, uncheck the Box add-in and press the OK button. Restart Word. The email address should be the MSOE email address, and the company should be Milwaukee School of Engineering. After creating the account, return to the activation wizard and use the login information to activate the software.

solution-article.title: Software Center - Common Issues
solution-article.description:
Title:

Software Center - Common Issues

Summary:
Occasionally Software Center will not download updates, and so will not display the correct software options for download.

Solution:

First, check for Windows Updates and install any found.


  • I don't find Software Center in the "Start" option
    1. Make sure the computer is wired in or connected to "Internal Domain"
    2. Go to Computer > M Drive > Software Center Install > install.bat
    3. It will install the software center
    4. Search "cmd" in the start option, right click on "Command Prompt" and run as administrator and hit "Yes".
    5. Type "gpupdate /force" and run the group policy.
    6. Restart the computer
    7. Go to "Configuration Manager" in "Control Panel"
    8. Go to "Actions" tab and run "Machine Policy Retrieval & Evaluation Cycle"
    9. Software Center will work just fine in 30 minutes
  • I don't see any software loading in Software Center

    1. Go to M Drive > Software Center Install > install.bat
    2. It will re-install the latest version of software. (The blue software center an old version)
    3. Search "cmd" in the start option, right click on "Command Prompt" and run as administrator and hit "Yes".
    4. Type "gpupdate/force" and run the group policy.
    5. Restart the computer
    6. Go to "Configuration Manager" in "Control Panel"
    7. Go to "Actions" tab and run "Machine Policy Retrieval & Evaluation Cycle"
    8. Software Center will work just fine in 30 minutes
  • This xyz Software doesn't install, it keeps failing!
    • Case -1 (I installed the software, but it doesn't show up anywhere on my computer.)
      1. The "Uninstall" button is most likely to be locked when this happens.
      2. Dig in to the C drive and look for the software folder (Ex. Look for MATLAB folder if they are facing issues with MATLAB)
      3. Delete that folder
      4. Run "Application Deployment and Evaluation Cycle" and "Software Updates Scan Cycle"
      5. Wait 30ish minutes and it will work.
  • Case-2 (I keep hitting "Install" button but it doesn't install)
        1. Search "cmd" in the start option, right click on "Command Prompt" and run as administrator and hit "Yes".
        2. Type "gpupdate/force" and run the group policy.
        3. Restart the computer
        4. Go to "Configuration Manager" in "Control Panel"
        5. Go to "Actions" tab and run "Machine Policy Retrieval & Evaluation Cycle"
        6. Wait 30ish minutes for it to work.
      • Case-3 (It keeps failing!)
        1. Look for the failure error code
        2. Check their C drive space (Ask them to clear some stuff if the space available is below 40GB)
        3. Resolve it like Case-1 and Case-2


    If the user wants to reinstall MATLAB:

    1. Delete the MATLAB folder in the C drive
    2. In the Configuration Manager, run the "Application Deployment and Evaluation Cycle"
    3. Next, run the "Software Updates Scan Cycle"
    4. Wait 30ish minutes, and it should work (if not immediately)

    Updated: 3/1/2018

solution-article.title: SolidWorks 2016 - Removing Files After Uninstalling from Control Panel
solution-article.description:
Title:

SolidWorks 2016 - Removing Files After Uninstalling from Control Panel

Summary:
Uninstalling SolidWorks from the Control Panel will uninstall the software, but sometimes leave files that will cause the computer to believe that SolidWorks is not completely uninstalled, which can cause problems down the line.

Solution:
In File Explorer, head to C:\Program Files\SOLIDWORKS Corp\SOLIDWORKS\HoopsPublish\resource\Font\. Open Control Panel. Click on Appearance and Personalization, and then Fonts. Delete any fonts that match the ones located at the \resourse\Font\ folder. Restart the computer. Delete all of the files in the \resource\Font\ folder.

Specifically for SolidWorks Electrical, the file EwServer in C:\Program Files\SOLIDWORKS Corp\SOLIDWORKS Electrical\server\ will not be deleted when uninstalled, and will not allow a user to delete it. To delete it, open Task Manager. Find the process called EwServer. Right click on it and choose End Task. This will allow the file to be deleted.

Updated: 3/1/2018

Solution: In File Explorer, head to C:\Program Files\SOLIDWORKS Corp\SOLIDWORKS\HoopsPublish\resource\Font\. Open Control Panel. Click on Appearance and Personalization, and then Fonts. Delete any fonts that match the ones located at the \resourse\Font\ folder. Restart the computer. Delete all of the files in the \resource\Font\ folder. Specifically for SolidWorks Electrical, the file EwServer in C:\Program Files\SOLIDWORKS Corp\SOLIDWORKS Electrical\server\ will not be deleted when uninstalled, and will not allow a user to delete it. To delete it, open Task Manager. Find the process called EwServer. Right click on it and choose End Task. This will allow the file to be deleted. Updated: 3/1/2018

solution-article.title: SolidWorks/AutoCAD - Errors or Restarting During Install
solution-article.description:
Title:

SolidWorks/AutoCAD - Errors or Restarting During Install

Summary:
Occasionally, Solidworks and AutoCAD will be unable to install on a system, causing the system to reboot in the middle of install, an error to be thrown, or simply stop the installer with no information at all. This is generally caused by an issue with the installation of the .NET 4.5 Framework.

Solution:
Head to the download page fro the .NET 4.5 Framework, at http://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=30653. Click the Download button and download and install the framework. Solidworks and AutoCAD should now be able to be installed.

Updated: 3/1/2018

This is generally caused by an issue with the installation of the .NET 4.5 Framework. Solution: Head to the download page fro the .NET 4.5 Framework, at http://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=30653. Click the Download button and download and install the framework. solution-article.title: Changing File Association - Windows 10
solution-article.description:
This guide is used for changing the default apps that open with file extensions for Windows 10.


1. Open Settings



2. Go to Apps -> Default Apps in Windows 10


3. At the bottom of the screen, go to 'Choose default apps by file type'


4. Scroll down until you find the file extension(s) you would like to change and click on the program next to the extension to change it.


5. You have successfully changed the file association!

solution-article.title: Microsoft Office Not Activating
solution-article.description:
Before moving forward, make sure the user is on the proper version of Office that you can install from software center. If the user has an old version of office, reinstall office before worrying about this solution.


---------------------------------------------------Causes---------------------------------------------------

*Generally windows 7 upgrading from office 2013 to 2016 Click to Run (what is in software center)

*Anyone updating from even old version of 2016 to our new version

*For the future--> Could happen with any update in office that licenses differently than the previous version



-------------------------------------------------Symptoms-------------------------------------------------

*Popup saying office is not valid and will expire in __X__ amount of days

*Reinstall doesn't fix the issue

*If the time runs out and office continues to work perfectly fine



--------------------------------------------------Solution--------------------------------------------------

1.) Open CMD as and administrator

2.) Type "cd C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft Office\Office16" and hit enter

3.) Type "cscript ospp.vbs /dstatus" and hit enter

This will display something like this on Command Prompt:


Now if this is in fact what is wrong there will be this plus another one or possibly more. 


4.) Now delete the licenses:

-Type "cscript ospp.vbs /unpkey:<last five characters of product key>" (last 5 of product key is the last line if information, in my example it is "abcde" and dont forget to remove the <> in the command)

-Rerun the command as many times as there are license and just change the last 5 of the product key each time.


5.) Reboot the computer and launch some office product (word or outlook for example)

-It will ask the person to activate office by logging in and after that you are finished



If you would like a link to the official page that I got my information from here is the link. there are some differences and I added more detail to fit our situation better than the one that they have.
https://community.spiceworks.com/how_to/48973-remove-and-re-add-license-key-for-office-2013-on-office-365

solution-article.title: Box cilent - upgrading to the newest version
solution-article.description:
Users who have the older Box sync software on their machines will have to update to the newer Box drive software to continue to use the software.


To determine if you are affected and which software you have.

1). open the control panel on your computer

3). search 'programs and features'

4). from the list of installed software find ether 'Box' or 'Box Sync' and check the version installed. Any version of 'Box sync' older than 4.0.7900 must be upgraded. It is also recommended to update any version of 'Box' older than 1.13.84 to the newest version.


The Process for updating Box Sync is the following.

1). Ensure that you have all of your work saved.

2). Open software center on your computer

3). Search for Box Drive and click install

4). This will automatically remove the older Box sync client and install the newest Box drive for you.

5). After the installation you will be asked to login to Box.


The process for updating Box Drive is the following.

1). Please save all of your work.

2). In the bottom right of your taskbar find the icon that has the box logo (you may have to hit the upward facing arrow to expand the pinned icons)

3). right click and select update. (If update is grayed out ensure that you are sign into box)

4). follow the prompts and the software should update.

solution-article.title: Outlook Mail Notification Icons and Alerts Not Working
solution-article.description:
---------------------------------------------------Causes---------------------------------------------------

*Seems to be caused by a Microsoft related issue with SSO and actually pulling proper profile 
information
*Windows 7 computers
*Office update from 2013 to 2016

-------------------------------------------------Symptoms-------------------------------------------------


*Office notifications don't pop up

*Mail Icon in taskbar doesn't appear

*Notification setting are properly set


--------------------------------------------------Solution--------------------------------------------------


*******************MAKE SURE OUTLOOK AND ALL OFFICE SOFTWARE IS CLOSED*******************


1.) Search Control Panel in Windows search

2.) Within Control Panel search for mail (Microsoft Outlook 2016) (32-bit)


3.) Double Click it and a window like this should pop up


4.) Click on show profiles...

5.) Remove all profiles by clicking on them and clicking the remove button
*
* THIS IS PERFECTLY SAFE AND DOESN'T DELETE YOUR MAIL, PST FILES, ETC.
*


6.) Hit Apply

7.) Launch Outlook and follow the first time login process


Now as it seems to be an intermittent Microsoft issue and this does fix it, it is possible the 
issue reappears a couple times before they patch the actual issue.

--------------------------------------------------Solution--------------------------------------------------

3.) Double Click it and a window like this should pop up
4.) Click on show profiles... 5.) Remove all profiles by clicking on them and clicking the remove button * * THIS IS PERFECTLY SAFE AND DOESN'T DELETE YOUR MAIL, PST FILES, ETC. *
6.) Hit Apply 7.) Launch Outlook and follow the first time login process
Now as it seems to be an intermittent Microsoft issue and this does fix it, it is possible the issue reappears a couple times before they patch the actual issue.

solution-article.title: SchoolDude - Creating an MSOE Maintenance Ticket Account
solution-article.description:
Maintenance tickets are generally for issues that do not include computers, the internet, printers, or telephones. This would include things like lack of power in a classroom or broken light fixtures, all the way to flooded hallways. 

In order to submit a maintenance ticket, you must first reset your password on the maintenance ticket tool. This guide is built to explain how to do just that.


  1. Go to community.msoe.edu

  2. If you are not already logged in, click on Log In. Otherwise, skip to step 4.

  3.  You will need to type in your credentials. Click Sign In. 

  4. Click on My News  

  5. Click on Maintenance & Custodial

  6. Click on Forgot Password

  7. Enter your email, click Submit
     

  8. You will be sent an email with a link to reset your password. Check your email and go to that enclosed link.

  9. Choose a password. Click Reset Password.

  10. Once done, you will be redirected to this page. Enter your email and new password and click Sign In.

  11. Congratulations! You can now submit maintenance and custodial tickets! Please follow the following guide to make a maintenance ticket.

http://helpdesk.msoe.edu/solution/categories/1000010350/folders/1000015760/articles/1000028844-how-to-submit-a-maintenance-ticket

If you are not already logged in, click on Log In. Otherwise, skip to step 4.
You will need to type in your credentials. Click Sign In.
Click on My News
Click on Maintenance & Custodial
Click on Forgot Password
Enter your email, click Submit
You will be sent an email with a link to reset your password. Check your email and go to that enclosed link.
Choose a password. Click Reset Password.

Congratulations! You can now submit maintenance and custodial tickets! Please follow the following guide to make a maintenance ticket.

solution-article.title: SchoolDude - Submitting an MSOE Maintenance Ticket
solution-article.description:
Maintenance tickets are generally for issues that do not include computers, the internet, printers, or telephones. This would include things like lack of power in a classroom or broken light fixtures, all the way to flooded hallways. 


Submitting Maintenance tickets is actually different from submitting IT tickets. If you make an IT ticket for a maintenance problem, the maintenance team will have no idea that your problem exists. 


Luckily, submitting maintenance tickets is explained here.


  1. First, go to https://community.msoe.edu
  2. Click on "Log in" on the right side of the page.


  3. Type in your MSOE credentials. Click Sign In.


  4. Click on "My News" in the top left corner of the page.


  5. Select "Maintenance & Custodial" near the right side from the generated option buttons.


  6. Type in your MSOE email and your password for the maintenance ticketing system. (This might not be the same password as your MSOE password).


  7. Fill out the request form. Step 1 should already be filled out for you. Anything marked with ais required.


  8. Select the problem type by clicking on the icon next to the department.


  9. Continue filling out the remaining parts of the form. Give a brief and concise description. Provide the time that you will be available if this requires you to be there (You must put something in that field in order to submit the request). The submittal  password is: raiders      Click Submit.


  10. Congratulations! Your maintenance ticket has been submitted and will be fixed!
solution-article.desc-un-html:
Maintenance tickets are generally for issues that do not include computers, the internet, printers, or telephones. This would include things like lack of power in a classroom or broken light fixtures, all the way to flooded hallways.
Submitting Maintenance tickets is actually different from submitting IT tickets. If you make an IT ticket for a maintenance problem, the maintenance team will have no idea that your problem exists.
Luckily, submitting maintenance tickets is explained here.
First, go to https://community.msoe.edu
Click on "Log in" on the right side of the page.
Type in your MSOE credentials. Click Sign In.
Click on "My News" in the top left corner of the page.
Select "Maintenance & Custodial" near the right side from the generated option buttons.
Type in your MSOE email and your password for the maintenance ticketing system. (This might not be the same password as your MSOE password).
Fill out the request form. Step 1 should already be filled out for you. Anything marked with ais required.
Select the problem type by clicking on the icon next to the department.
Continue filling out the remaining parts of the form. Give a brief and concise description. Provide the time that you will be available if this requires you to be there (You must put something in that field in order to submit the request). The submittal password is: raiders Click Submit.
Congratulations! Your maintenance ticket has been submitted and will be fixed!

solution-article.title: Browser Error - Virus Download Blocked
solution-article.description:
While downloading a file, the following message is encountered:


VIRUS DOWNLOAD BLOCKED - The Download of a file containing a virus has been Automatically blocked by the MSOE Firewall. Please contact the Firewall administrator if you believe this is in error.


MSOE subscribes to a file sandbox service that detects new files on the network and detonates them in a secure environment. This process only runs on new files that it has never seen, or files that have the same name as a known file, but a different file hash. Until the file comes back as clean by the service, any files by that name and matching hash are blocked by the firewall. The process normally takes 24-72 hours. In most cases, the file is approved by the service and becomes a known good object. One it has passed this process, the above message will not appear, and you can safely download your file.

In some cases, the file will be considered malicious due to the file system changes it makes, and will be blocked indefinitely. Because these files have been tested in a sandbox, false positives are very unlikely. MSOE will not whitelist files that the service has determined to be malicious due to the risk the file may pose.

If you are certain your file is not malicious, you may wish to try and download it from another site, or wait a few days to see if the file is approved.

In some cases, the file will be considered malicious due to the file system changes it makes, and will be blocked indefinitely. Because these files have been tested in a sandbox, false positives are very unlikely. MSOE will not whitelist files that the service has determined to be malicious due to the risk the file may pose. If you are certain your file is not malicious, you may wish to try and download it from another site, or wait a few days to see if the file is approved.

solution-article.title: Using ilos Lecture and Screen Capture
solution-article.description:
Title:

Using ilos Lecture and Screen Capture


Summary:

As we move ahead in the Information Age, many professors have realized the potential of video as a component of their courses. I have worked with many of you this past quarter to acquire screen-capture software and recording/lecture-capture solutions for the classroom.


In researching screen-casting and lecture-capture solutions, I discovered a platform called ilos. ilos is a simple way for faculty to create quick video content.


ilos is currently working with Faculty at UC Berkeley, Lake Superior College, and the University of St. Thomas, where they’ve had over a 30% institutional adoption, and recently won the Under the Ed Radar Pitch Competition at the annual EDUCAUSE Conference.


MSOE has licensed ilos! This means you can record your lectures, screen-cast PowerPoint presentations, and generate exciting visual material for free! Follow the link below, read the instructions, and push a button to record. It’s that simple! There’s even an iOS and Android App for easy recording and uploading.


To try ilos – contact the IT Helpdesk.


Updated: 3/2/2018

solution-article.title: Clutter in Outlook
solution-article.description:
Title:

Clutter in Outlook


Summary:

Clutter helps you move low priority messages out of your Inbox so that you can easily scan for important messages. Clutter analyzes your emails, and based on your past behavior, determines the messages that you’re most likely to ignore. It then moves those messages to a folder called Clutter so that you can review them later.


It might take Clutter a few days to fully adapt to your preference, as the system records your choices and uses the information to identify similar messages in the future. But you can help Clutter learn your choices faster. If you see a message that was sent to Clutter by mistake, move it from the Clutter folder to your Inbox. If you see a low priority email in your Inbox, move it to the Clutter folder.


Clutter and junk email are both filtered out before they reach your Inbox. Junk email is evaluated and filtered first, then Outlook processes the rules, if you have set up any. Next, Clutter analyzes the remaining messages and filters out the types of messages that you usually ignore or don't respond to, based on your past behavior.

Messages from certain people will never be identified as clutter: You, anyone in your management chain and your direct reports. Clutter looks at various aspects of messages to understand what you don’t typically read, for example: The sender, whether you’ve participated in the conversation, if you’re the only recipient and the importance. As your reading habits change, Clutter learns and adapts.


You can turn Clutter off at any time in Outlook Web App. Sign in to Outlook Web App. Then go to Settings>Options>Mail>Automatic processing>Clutter. Select Don't separate items identified as Clutter, and then click Save. NOTE: The Clutter folder remains in Outlook after you turn off Clutter. If you don’t want the folder listed under your Mailbox, move the emails from Clutter to other folders as appropriate, and then delete the Clutter folder.


Updated: 3/2/2018

solution-article.title: Malware Alert Text.txt
solution-article.description:
Title:

Malware Alert Text.txt


Summary:

You may occasionally get an email with an attachments listed as "Malware Alert Text.txt". This obviously looks suspicious, and it should. It means that Outlook 365 detected a malicious attachment on your email and removed it. The file it is replaced with indicates that the malicious file was removed. The included text in the attachment reads as follows:


An attempt to deliver an attachment that contained malware was blocked. If the sender is someone you know please contact them and inform them that their account might be compromised. If you have any questions please contact the helpdesk at 414-277-7288


You can safely delete or archive the email. Remain vigilant for these types of emails and attachments. Don't open emails or attachments from people you don't know, that look suspicious, or aren't expecting an attachment. As always, if you are unsure, open a ticket to the Helpdesk (helpdesk@msoe.edu) or call them at extension x7288.


Updated: 3/2/2018

solution-article.title: Stolen Computer Procedures
solution-article.description:
Title:

Stolen Computer Procedures


Problem:

A student, staff or faculty member has had their MSOE laptop stolen.


Solution:

When a computer is stolen, follow the following steps.


Notify the MSOE Public Safety department and the MSOE IT Helpdesk. Public Safety can be reached at 414-277-7169. The MSOE IT Helpdesk can be reached at 414-277-7288, by emailing helpdesk@msoe.edu, or by submitting a ticket at msoe.freshservice.com.


Contact the appropriate law enforcement agency. If the computer is stolen from an on-campus location, report the theft to the MSOE Public Safety department and local law enforcement to obtain a police report. If the computer is stolen from an off-campus location, contact the local law enforcement agency to obtain a police report.


Provide a copy of the police report to the MSOE IT Helpdesk. This can be done in person or by email.

solution-article.title: Student Withdrawing From All Classes Or Otherwise No Longer Full-Time
solution-article.description:
Title:

Student Withdrawing From All Classes Or Otherwise No Longer Full-Time


Problem:

A student has withdrawn from all classes, or is otherwise no longer enrolled in enough credits to be considered full-time, and is wondering what needs to be done for the MSOE IT Helpdesk.


Solution:

When a student has dropped all classes, they are required to return their MSOE laptop to the MSOE IT Helpdesk. Regardless of if the student is currently enrolled for the following term, the MSOE IT Helpdesk needs to hold on to the laptop while the student is not at the current time in full-time status. If the student registers for classes again, the laptop can be returned to the student on the first day of classes during the term that they are enrolled full-time.


If the student has dropped classes to the point that they are currently considered part-time instead of full-time, they get a grace period of one term where they do not need to return their laptop. It is only when a student registers as part-time that they would need to return their MSOE laptop.
solution-article.desc-un-html:
Title: Student Withdrawing From All Classes Or Otherwise No Longer Full-Time
Problem: A student has withdrawn from all classes, or is otherwise no longer enrolled in enough credits to be considered full-time, and is wondering what needs to be done for the MSOE IT Helpdesk.
Solution: When a student has dropped all classes, they are required to return their MSOE laptop to the MSOE IT Helpdesk. Regardless of if the student is currently enrolled for the following term, the MSOE IT Helpdesk needs to hold on to the laptop while the student is not at the current time in full-time status. If the student registers for classes again, the laptop can be returned to the student on the first day of classes during the term that they are enrolled full-time.
If the student has dropped classes to the point that they are currently considered part-time instead of full-time, they get a grace period of one term where they do not need to return their laptop. It is only when a student registers as part-time that they would need to return their MSOE laptop.

solution-article.title: Slow/Bad Wireless in MSOE Grohmann Tower
solution-article.description:
Grohmann Tower Residents,


[UPDATE 1/30/17]

MSOE VPN (GlobalProtect) is currently working on Tower internet. We will continue to monitor usage on the new circuit, but it should now be stable for all users and allow VPN connections to campus.


[UPDATE 1/26/17]

The Tower Internet conversion is now complete. Residents now have direct, unfiltered access to the internet over both IPv4 and IPv6. Please use the SSID 'Tower' or the wall ports located in your room to connect to the internet. 

KNOWN ISSUE: Routing back to campus is currently not working as expected. This means GlobalProtect VPN, printer services, and license servers are not available from Tower wireless or your wall ports. While we work on this issue, we have left MSOE Wireless enabled on the access points in the 4th floor conference and study areas. We continue to troubleshoot this issue and will post updates here. Please contact the helpdesk with any questions.


[UPDATE 1/24/17]

Testing of the circuit is complete. We plan to convert the Tower residents to their own dedicated internet circuit on 1/26 from 5am to 7am. Internet at the Tower will be down during this conversion. You will lose access to MSOE internet-routable IP addresses and will be provided a NAT address that hands off directly to an internet circuit. You will no longer be able to directly access the MSOE academic network from the Tower. In order to reach print servers, domain controllers, and license servers, you will need to connect via GlobalProtect VPN. The Acceptable Use Policy is still in effect, and you will be responsible for the use of the network.


[UPDATE 1/9/17]

A new internet circuit has been installed and we are currently testing the DHCP and NAT to provide residents their own network, separate from the MSOE academic network. Expected install will be in 1-2 weeks.


[UPDATE 12/1/16]

A new wireless network name (SSID) called "Tower" has been added to the Grohman Tower wireless access points, and MSOE wireless has been removed. This is to prepare the wireless for the upcoming internet circuit so that all wireless traffic can be router to the internet. Please contact the MSOE Helpdesk or Grohmann Tower employees for the password to this wireless network.


[UPDATE 10/12/16]

Our ISP has stated that they should have dedicated internet to the Tower by the first week of January. This will give the residents direct access to the internet without first traversing the MSOE academic circuit and firewalls. More information will be provided as that project approaches.


[UPDATE 10/7/16]

Created a Tower-only wireless SSID, currently called simply "Tower" that bypasses the extra return trip to the datacenter for routing. Will send out an email to phase out MSOE and MSOE-Guest for this new SSID after testing.


[UPDATE 9/23/16]

Updated firmware on Tower hardware, and had connection between CC and Tower realigned.


[UPDATE 9/21/16]

Removed firewall policies blocking aggressive traffic. We had been using these policies to troubleshoot ongoing issues. All traffic is now allowed, though aggressive traffic will be given a lower priority.


[UPDATE 9/20/16]

We have disabled 802.11b as it is an older, slower protocol that may stall traffic queues. We have removed 2.4ghz radio as a selection as its channel selection is very limited and can cause problems. We saw that a number of users in the Tower had their own wireless routers, and these will cause channel selection problems in 2.4ghz, and to a lesser extent in 5.0ghz. You should consider disabling the wireless on your personal routers as they may cause performance issues with other residents.


[UPDATE 9/19/16]

We are working on a separate wireless network for the Tower to isolate the problems. We expect to have it ready sometime this week.


[UPDATE 9/14/16]

A firewall has been installed between the Tower and the MSOE Campus. Please remember to be courteous of your fellow residents, adhere to the Acceptable Use Policy, and use the MSOE resources respectfully. These resources are provided for all of the residents of the Towers. Abuse of these resources will be reported to the Building Manager. 



We are aware of the problems you are experiencing with wired and wireless in the Tower. Problems began on Move-in day, and have continued ever since. Each day at around 6:30 PM, the connection from the Tower to MSOE drops all traffic and resets. Normally this will happen if a traffic queue fills up or if a link becomes overwhelmed with traffic, such as broadcasts.


Long Term:

We are currently working with local telecom companies to get the Tower off of the MSOE network and onto its own internet circuit that is not routed through MSOE. For this change, we are constrained to the permits and schedule of the telecom. We have asked for an update and an ETA and will update this Solution when we know more.


Short Term:

We have purchased a firewall to implement the above solution. In the meantime, we can configure and deploy the firewall to locate and block malicious traffic. We have begun the design and implementation of the firewall today and hope to be able to deploy it with minimal downtime in the next week. This is not a long term solution, and when the above telecom circuit is installed, the firewall will need to be reconfigured for the new changes, and will be accompanied by a substantial downtime. We will notify you by email before this happens, so please check your email for notifications from the Helpdesk.


What Can You Do Today?

Check your personal network devices:

Each suite is allowed one active network port, so many residents have their own routers and switches. If your router has wireless, please disable it and use the MSOE provided wireless. Additional wireless signals will only negatively impact the other residents of the Tower. 

Check your router ports. If you have multiple active ports in your suite and they are both connected to the router, this can cause additional traffic, broadcast storms, and loops. The switches in the building are resistant to all of these effects, but it will still negatively impact the overall quality of everyone connected to the same network closet. When we find ports that are causing loops, we will disable them with no warning to the resident. Repeated offenses will be reported to building management.

Check your servers:

Are you running a server that may be broadcasting DHCP, AppleTalk, or Multicast traffic? If you do, please put this device behind a router to insulate the rest of the network closet and the building from your broadcast traffic. While the Tower is your home, and servers of this nature are not forbidden, traffic that negatively impacts other residents is strictly forbidden.

Are you running a server that may be using unreasonable bandwidth? Are you hosting a torrent server or another filesharing service? If you do, please put this device behind a router to insulate the rest of the network closet and the building from your traffic. Review your configuration settings to ensure that you are not using unreasonable amounts of bandwidth that may affect other residents.

Finally, exercise common sense and courtesy. You are not on a direct internet connection - you are using a shared campus resource. Unreasonable and/or suspicious use that affects residents or other students will not be tolerated.


Please review the attached Acceptable Use Policy.

solution-article.title: Wireless Settings and Information
solution-article.description:
Title:

Wireless Settings and Information


Summary:

MSOE-Wireless

Manual Settings for Android, Unix, and other systems

SSID: MSOE

Encryption: WPA2-Enterprise (PEAP/MSCHAPv2)

Encryption Type: AES

Username: domain_username (do not include "@msoe.edu")

Password: domain_password

Trusted Auth Servers: radius1.msoe.edu, radius2.msoe.edu


IPv6: Disabled

2.4ghz Radio: Enabled on centrally located access points on each floor of each building, and all access points in CC Great Room

5.0ghz Radio: Enabled on all access points


MSOE Wireless is provided for MSOE Students, Staff, and Faculty to connect to the MSOE network with MSOE laptops running Windows 7 and Windows 10. The settings details provided above should be enough information to join additional operating systems to wireless with MSOE domain credentials. At this time, the Helpdesk does not support BYOD or operating systems other than the custom Win 7 and Win 10 images provided by IT.


Windows 7 laptops provided by MSOE, that are members of the MSOE domain, will automatically try to join join the SSID "MSOE Internal Domain" with the account used to sign onto the computer. This will automatically authenticate users if they sign into their computer with their MSOE credentials.


Windows 10 laptops provided by MSOE, that are members of the MSOE domain, will automatically try to join join the SSID "MSOEcert" with an encrypted local certificate. This will automatically authenticate the laptop to the the SSID, irrespective of the credentials. The certificate will renew in intervals as long as the laptop connects to MSOEcert periodically.


Adjusted 2.4ghz Radios

In some areas of the campus, we have reduced the number of access points broadcasting 2.4ghz wavelengths. The overlap of these access points, and the outside interference of this very commonly encountered frequency was causing channel interference . The interference on the 3 usable channels caused connections to the APs to be unreliable. Devices that were capable of 5.0ghz, including the MSOE laptops deployed over the last six years, were defaulting to 2.5ghz even when 5.0ghz was available. This caused users to experience a slower and less reliable network. To ensure that your devices connected to wireless at the best speeds, with the least amount of interference, and the lowest possibility of channel hopping, we disabled select 2.4ghz radios. 


In those areas where 2.4ghz is still required, we increased the power of a single 2.4ghz radio on that floor, locked it to a single channel, and disabled overlapping 2.4ghz radios.


Updated: 3/2/2018

solution-article.title: LocalGPO not able to be updated/Unable to connect to MSOE Cert
solution-article.description:
Issue

“The processing of Group Policy failed. Windows could not apply the registry-based policy settings for the Group Policy object LocalGPO.  Group Policy settings will not be resolved until this event is resolved. View the event details for more information on the file name and path that caused the failure.”

 

Fix

Go to “C:\Windows\System32\GroupPolicy\Machine\”

Rename Registry.pol to Registry.pol.bak

Open an elevated command prompt

Type in gpedit.msc

Change “Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Control Panel\Personalization\Force a specific default lock screen and logon image” to FALSE and back to Not Configured (This will rebuild the Registry.pol file).

Return to the elevated command prompt and run gpupdate /force. It should ask to log off.

Log back on and run gpupdate /force again.
solution-article.desc-un-html:
Issue “The processing of Group Policy failed. Windows could not apply the registry-based policy settings for the Group Policy object LocalGPO. Group Policy settings will not be resolved until this event is resolved. View the event details for more information on the file name and path that caused the failure.”
Fix Go to “C:\Windows\System32\GroupPolicy\Machine\” Rename Registry.pol to Registry.pol.bak Open an elevated command prompt Type in gpedit.msc Change “Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Control Panel\Personalization\Force a specific default lock screen and logon image” to FALSE and back to Not Configured (This will rebuild the Registry.pol file). Return to the elevated command prompt and run gpupdate /force. It should ask to log off. Log back on and run gpupdate /force again.

solution-article.title: On-Campus Housing WiFi
solution-article.description:
Starting in Summer of 2018, MSOE will only be providing wired internet access in on-campus housing.  WiFi internet access will not be provided to residents, except in public or in instructional areas of buildings.


If residents of On-Campus housing wish to have WiFi access in their rooms, they will need to provide their own WiFi access points.


For the Fall - 2018 semester, MSOE can recomend the two following WiFi routers:


  • TP-LINK Archer AC1200 ($50)
  • NETGEAR Nighthawk R6700v3 ($90)
Details and some configuration instructions can be found in the attached document.

solution-article.title: Adobe Creative Cloud - Who Has Access
solution-article.description:
Adobe Creative Cloud desktop applications, including Acrobat Pro and Photoshop are available to all Faculty and Staff. These programs can be found in Software Center on Windows 10. Additional Adobe Creative Cloud applications can be requested by Faculty and Staff. These can be added to Software Center based on a review process by IT in conjunction with our Adobe Enterprise Licensing Agreement, and with MSOE policy. Student access to Adobe Creative Cloud applications must be associated with an MSOE class and will be limited to deployment on MSOE-owned devices on campus. Any application requests for a class must come from the course instructor.

 

WHAT ADOBE CREATIVE CLOUD DESKTOP APPLICATIONS ARE AVAILABLE?

Adobe Creative Cloud offers twenty-eight desktop applications. A full list of products can be found in the link at the bottom of this article. Please be aware: the full "Creative Cloud" desktop installer and any development applications are not available for deployment based on our license and policy.

 

HOW DO I REQUEST AN APPLICATION?

If the desktop applications you need is not listed in Software Center, you can request an application or a list of applications by opening a ticket to the Helpdesk (helpdesk@msoe.edu). General requests for “all applications” cannot be fulfilled, so please list the specific applications you need, and a brief summary of what it will be used for.

 

ARE THERE ANY LIMITATIONS TO APPLICATION REQUESTS OR USE?

The Enterprise agreement is limited to faculty and staff devices, and MSOE-owned on-campus devices. The "Creative Cloud" desktop app is a standalone installer for all the applications, and is not part of our deployment license.

 

If you have any questions regarding the installation of any of these desktop applications, please open a ticket to Helpdesk (helpdesk@msoe.edu) and we will do our best to provide a solution.

 

HELPFUL RESOURCES

https://www.adobe.com/creativecloud/catalog/desktop.html

solution-article.title: Box Website - Folder Sharing
solution-article.description:
A box.com folder can be shared with anyone you'd like. It can be shared to individual users, or it can be shared with anyone that has the link, it can be passworded, or made public. However, box.com is not related to MSOE MS Active Directory - meaning there are only folders and accounts for individual users. There are not folders for departments, or groups like in email. The two systems are separate companies (Microsoft and Box) and at this time, there is not a method to combine the folder or group hierarchy.


Below are two links for setting up and using Box. One is a doc created by Mike Timm here at MSOE that is customized to the MSOE environment. The other link comes directly from Box and explains detailed use of their product. 


http://boxuniversity.litmos.com/online-courses


FOLDERS CANNOT BE CREATED WITH ACTIVE DIRECTORY GROUP ACCESS. Box and Microsoft Active Directory unfortunately are not linked at this time; the companies do not share a method to incorporate group access.

solution-article.title: Using ilos Video Recording
solution-article.description:
As we move ahead in the Information Age, many professors have realized the potential of video as a component of their courses. I have worked with many of you this past quarter to acquire screen-capture software and recording/lecture-capture solutions for the classroom.


In researching screen-casting and lecture-capture solutions, I discovered a platform called ilos. ilos is a simple way for faculty to create quick video content.


ilos is currently working with Faculty at UC Berkeley, Lake Superior College, and the University of St. Thomas, where they’ve had over a 30% institutional adoption, and recently won the Under the Ed Radar Pitch Competition at the annual EDUCAUSE Conference.


MSOE has licensed ilos! This means you can record your lectures, screen-cast PowerPoint presentations, and generate exciting visual material for free! Follow the link below, read the instructions, and push a button to record. It’s that simple! There’s even an iOS and Android App for easy recording and uploading.


To try ilos – click on the following link:

https://app.ilosvideos.com/login

solution-article.title: MSOE-LIB Ruckus Proof Of Concept
solution-article.description:
Faculty and Staff in the Walter Schroeder Library Building,

 

We will be doing a second proof of concept (POC) for the wireless network in the Library during the week of February 27th to March 3rd. The changes that are most likely to impact occupants of the Library will occur throughout the day on Tuesday, February 28th. We expect these changes will only impact wireless connections. All wired access should remain reliable. If for any reason we need to make a change to wired access, we will do a walkthrough of the building and provide advance notice.

The wireless network name in the library will change from MSOE to MSOE-LIB. You may still be able to connect to MSOE if you can receive a signal from the Science Building; however, you may experience very slow speeds and/or get disconnected on MSOE if your connection is over a long distance. We advise you to please consider using only MSOE-LIB in the Library during this POC.

Some Useful Information:

MSOE-LIB will use your MSOE domain credentials.

MSOE-Guest will not require credentials, but will be operating on the POC hardware.

If you are unable to connect to MSOE-LIB, please contact the Helpdesk and use a wired connection or use MSOE-Guest in the interim.

We will spend the week testing speeds and devices and making sure the change in wireless is an improvement over our current solution.

If the POC is a success, we will send out an email to all faculty, staff, and students making everyone aware of the changes.

Should the POC prove unsuccessful, we will restore the original MSOE wireless network by Friday.

 

For more information, please contact the Helpdesk

No MSOE employee nor any MSOE correspondence will ever ask for your account password.

solution-article.title: Qualtrics
solution-article.description:
The faculty member who handles this is JILL MEYER, the Assistant VP of Institutional Effectiveness. It used to be handled by Dr. Michael Payne from the Business School, but it is now handled by Jill. 

PROCEDURE:

A ticket must be submitted by or about the user in question in order to gain access.
When a ticket is sent in, click 'Forward' instead of Reply, and forward the ticket to Jill Meyer explaining that the user needs access and what the purpose is. She will reply when access has been granted. Give her a call if it has been over 3 days without response. 
When she replies, it will likely be as a private note, so send a reply to the user letting them know their access has been granted, and resolve the ticket.


Background: Qualtrics is a web service that allows users to create and track surveys. There is a free version; MSOE has one of the paid versions of the software. Please contact Jill Meyer if you are interested in using Qualtrics.

solution-article.title: Alumni Email account - "This account cannot be accessed because your credentials were not verified"
solution-article.description:
Sometime a user will report that they can't login to their new alumni gmail account due to the error above. This error is almost always tied to using your username instead of your full @alumni.msoe.edu address when logging into ADFS.


From the users perspective the process should look something like this.

1). navigate to gmail.com

2). enter username@alumni.msoe.edu address

4). user will be redirected to our MSOE ADFS login page

5). User will enter username@alumni.msoe.edu and alumni email password

* it must be @alumni.msoe.edu or you get the error above

6). user will be taken to mailbox


If the problem persists please send the issue to the sysadmin team.

solution-article.title: Projector Resolution Blurry in Duplicate Mode
solution-article.description: Lower the resolution on the tablet or laptop until the projector looks cleaner. This is in the advanced settings of the display settings. There is no exact resolution that will fix the issue but just keep lowering it until it looks nice. This is caused because in duplicate mode, the computer will force it's resolution onto the display screen even if the screen doesn't support it. So if you simply lower the resolution it will fix the issue. Optional: Explain how to change the resolution so they can change between the projectors resolution when they are using it and the default resolution for the machine for regular use. Not the biggest deal but this will insure the best picture scaling at all times.

solution-article.title: Replacing VGA Cables in the Library Study Rooms
solution-article.description:
Items required:

  • 15 ft VGA Cable with built in aux cord (10 ft is not preferred but it works)
  • Side Snips
  • Allen Wrench Set (or Pliers which are less ideal)
  • Screw Driver
  • Pull Ties


To replace the VGA cord:

  1. Identifying the bad VGA cord in the system
  2. Unplug the VGA cord from the TV it is connected to
  3. Test a new VGA cord on that TV to make sure that fixes the problem
  4. If the new cord works, remove the back metal panel from the TV stand by removing the screws holding the panel (use an Allen Wrench for this, or the Pliers)
  5. Use the Side Snips to cut the Pull Ties underneath the table in order to extract the bad VGA cable
  6. Remove the bad cable from inside the stand and underneath the table
  7. Feed the new cable through the TV stand and underneath the table
  8. Connect the new VGA cord to the TV
  9. Use the Pull Ties to hold the cables to the table (in other words, replace the Pull Ties that you cut earlier) (don't pull them too tight, but only tight enough)
  10. Cut any extra tail off of the Pull Ties
  11. Pull the connecting end of the VGA onto the table (not the end that is connected to the TV) and test it to make sure it works
  12. Put the back panel of the TV stand back on the stand

15 ft VGA Cable with built in aux cord (10 ft is not preferred but it works) Side Snips Allen Wrench Set (or Pliers which are less ideal) Screw Driver Pull Ties

Identifying the bad VGA cord in the system
Unplug the VGA cord from the TV it is connected to Test a new VGA cord on that TV to make sure that fixes the problem If the new cord works, remove the back metal panel from the TV stand by removing the screws holding the panel (use an Allen Wrench for this, or the Pliers) Use the Side Snips to cut the Pull Ties underneath the table in order to extract the bad VGA cable Remove the bad cable from inside the stand and underneath the table Feed the new cable through the TV stand and underneath the table Connect the new VGA cord to the TV Use the Pull Ties to hold the cables to the table (in other words, replace the Pull Ties that you cut earlier) (don't pull them too tight, but only tight enough) Cut any extra tail off of the Pull Ties Pull the connecting end of the VGA onto the table (not the end that is connected to the TV) and test it to make sure it works Put the back panel of the TV stand back on the stand

solution-article.title: Using Air-Media
solution-article.description:
Always encourage faculty/staff to use Air-media.


Follow the following steps to connect to a Laptop using AirMedia.

  • Turn on the classroom smart system by clicking the touch screen.
  • Select the Projector of interest.
  • Select the Air-media option.(Now an image is projected with the IP address and code, they are clearly labeled)
  • On your computer Open your browser and enter the IP address as displayed.
  • Download the AirMedia Client Application on your laptop.
  • Click on the downloaded application and enter the code as displayed.
  • Make sure to unmute the sound button.
  • Wireless connection is now  established.
solution-article.desc-un-html:
Always encourage faculty/staff to use Air-media.
Follow the following steps to connect to a Laptop using AirMedia.
Turn on the classroom smart system by clicking the touch screen. Select the Projector of interest. Select the Air-media option.(Now an image is projected with the IP address and code, they are clearly labeled) On your computer Open your browser and enter the IP address as displayed.
Download the AirMedia Client Application on your laptop.
Click on the downloaded application and enter the code as displayed. Make sure to unmute the sound button. Wireless connection is now established.

solution-article.title: ADP 4500 Time Clocks - Installation and Configuration
solution-article.description:
You will need an ADP Maintenance Swipe Card. This is an ADP card with an M in a circle on one side and a mag stripe on the other. This will take you directly to the configuration menu of an ADP time clock. 

One card is kept with the Infrastructure Support Specialist, another card is kept in the HR office. 


Once you have swiped the card, select the Communication Setup button.


Each device has an ID that it uses to communicate with the ADP server in the cloud. Therefore you will need to verify that the port for the device has internet access and that the device has already been added to the ADP server by HR.


To configure the device, use the example below. Please keep in mind the information in RED is specific to the example and will be different for all installs. The rest of the information is correct for all campus time clock installs.


Please verify the networp IP address, Gateway, and Mask with the Network Administrator


IP: 155.92.172.28

GATEWAY: 155.92.173.254

MASK: 255.255.254.0

DNS: No

DHCP: No

FIRMWARE: 03.00.01.018 (Or Higher)

CONFIG: SC SG2 4500 Profile with Biometrics

LOCATION: Lee's Lounge, First floor, SCIENCE

COMMUNICATION: Device Initiated

PRIMARY SERVER: 170.146.39.22

SSL: YES

PRIMARY SERVER PORT: 443

PRIMARY SERVER INSTANCE ID: 16155

DEVICE ID: 017228 (six digits of IP address)

PRIMARY SERVER PASSWORD: 123456


If you need to involved ADP support, you will need to contact HR and have them involve the vendor.

solution-article.title: High Disk Activity Issue - Kaspersky Vulnerability Monitor, "Find vulnerabilities and required updates" Issue.
solution-article.description:
Problem: 

Client machines experience up to 100% HD access.  Task Manager shows Vulnerability Monitor is the cause.


Solution:

Vulnerability monitor is Task ("Find vulnerabilities and required updates") that can be started or stopped at the KSC.  Login to the Endpoint server, check under Tasks and stop the "Find vulnerabilities and required updates" task.  This will stop the high disk activity on clients under that managed group.
solution-article.desc-un-html:
Problem: Client machines experience up to 100% HD access. Task Manager shows Vulnerability Monitor is the cause.
Solution: Vulnerability monitor is Task ("Find vulnerabilities and required updates") that can be started or stopped at the KSC. Login to the Endpoint server, check under Tasks and stop the "Find vulnerabilities and required updates" task. This will stop the high disk activity on clients under that managed group.

solution-article.title: Computer Won't Network Boot / Blank Boot Menu / Deployment Toolkit Not Showing Up
solution-article.description:
All computer's we have on hand besides the EliteBook 85__s should be set to UEFI in BIOS before applying any image. This solution is specifically written for the BIOS version on computer’s newer than G1/G2 (N81 Ver. 01.09)


If you are trying to UEFI network boot, but you are stuck at a blank, white BIOS boot menu screen and unable to select IPv4 or IPv6:

Enter BIOS Setup (F10)

Apply factory defaults and exit, are you sure: yes

Wait for computer to turn itself off and back on


If you can select IPv4 and you can select SCCM ___ boot on the blue screen, but you are unable to get to the deployment toolkit screen:

Enter BIOS Setup (F10)

Enter BIOS password if asked (note: if grad imaging, password should be removed)

Navigate to advanced tab

Key down to secure boot configuration, enter

Check the box next to: clear secure boot keys

     If this option is not there, check the box next to: reset secure boot keys to factory defaults

     Finish the steps in this block, then repeat the block: the missing option should now appear

Press F10, yes save changes

Wait for computer to turn itself off and back on


UEFI has been turned off automatically from doing the steps above. So turn it back on:

Enter BIOS Setup (F10)

Enter BIOS password if asked (note: if grad imaging, password should be removed)

Navigate to advanced tab

Key down to secure boot configuration, enter

Turn on UEFI by:

     Configure drop down box to legacy support disable and secure boot disable

     Enter

Press F10, yes save changes

Wait for computer to turn itself off and back on


Note: boot menu now may suddenly be blank. Follow steps to fix that at the top of this doc
solution-article.desc-un-html:
All computer's we have on hand besides the EliteBook 85__s should be set to UEFI in BIOS before applying any image. This solution is specifically written for the BIOS version on computer’s newer than G1/G2 (N81 Ver. 01.09)
If you are trying to UEFI network boot, but you are stuck at a blank, white BIOS boot menu screen and unable to select IPv4 or IPv6:
Enter BIOS Setup (F10)
Apply factory defaults and exit, are you sure: yes
Wait for computer to turn itself off and back on
If you can select IPv4 and you can select SCCM ___ boot on the blue screen, but you are unable to get to the deployment toolkit screen:
Enter BIOS Setup (F10)
Enter BIOS password if asked (note: if grad imaging, password should be removed)
Navigate to advanced tab
Key down to secure boot configuration, enter
Check the box next to: clear secure boot keys
If this option is not there, check the box next to: reset secure boot keys to factory defaults
Finish the steps in this block, then repeat the block: the missing option should now appear
Press F10, yes save changes
Wait for computer to turn itself off and back on
UEFI has been turned off automatically from doing the steps above. So turn it back on:
Enter BIOS Setup (F10)
Enter BIOS password if asked (note: if grad imaging, password should be removed)
Navigate to advanced tab
Key down to secure boot configuration, enter
Turn on UEFI by:
Configure drop down box to legacy support disable and secure boot disable
Enter
Press F10, yes save changes
Wait for computer to turn itself off and back on
Note: boot menu now may suddenly be blank. Follow steps to fix that at the top of this doc

solution-article.title: Issues with a Printer Using Follow You Printing Not Working for Anyone
solution-article.description:
This solution is intended for when a single printer is not printing any jobs for all users. If you are looking for when one user is not able to print to any printer on Follow You Printing, this solution may help more.


If you print a document from your computer and then scan your ID on a printer that uses Follow You Printing and nothing prints even though the jobs have disappeared from your queue, and you are able to print from any other printer, then the printer is having an issue with its connection to the print server. The printer itself will probably not show any errors, since from its perspective nothing is wrong, it just isn't getting any jobs.


The most common form of this is a loose connection from one of the network cables. This doesn't only include cables that are connected to the printer, but also cables from the box that the ID scanner is connected to. Check each cable to make sure that each connection is solid. If the connections are all good, a cable may have broken and would need to be replaced.

The printer itself will probably not show any errors, since from its perspective nothing is wrong, it just isn't getting any jobs.
The most common form of this is a loose connection from one of the network cables. This doesn't only include cables that are connected to the printer, but also cables from the box that the ID scanner is connected to. Check each cable to make sure that each connection is solid. If the connections are all good, a cable may have broken and would need to be replaced.

To fix this on ether a client or on the server go to printer properties / device settings / automatic configuration / update now
