solution-article.title: Adobe Enterprise Term License Agreement - How To Request and Deploy
solution-article.description:
As you may already know, MSOE purchased an Enterprise license for Adobe software. This allows unlimited installs to faculty and staff devices, and limited installs on other MSOE devices on campus. However, the license does not allow us to distribute a complete catalog installer, so each program will need to be installed separately from Software Center. Each application will be added to Software Center by the system admin team, but will only be available/visible to specific groups based on the request.

Currently, only Acrobat Pro is listed in Software Center, and is only visible to faculty and staff. If you get a request for other Adobe applications, you will need to submit a ticket that lists which application is being requested, and who it’s for. If it’s for faculty and staff, we will likely create an installer and make it visible to all faculty and staff. If it’s for a class, we will limit the installation to users in that program. Please make sure what when you are dealing with a request for Adobe software that you determine who it’s for and what scope they plan to implement it (individual use, class, lab machine, etc). Please be aware: we will not be supporting student requests for licenses. Any software requests for students will need to come from the instructor and be approved through the System Admins.

If you have any questions regarding the process or the license, please let me know. I’d be happy to explain in greater detail. A list of the available Desktop products can be found below. Please feel free to pass this information along to the Helpdesk. I will also add it to a private Solution in FreshService.

http://www.adobe.com/creativecloud/catalog/desktop.html

Please be aware: Development tools will have limited access. There shouldn't be a need for most administrative departments to be doing development work, so we will limit who will be given access. All apps will be subject to review and approval.

If you get a request for other Adobe applications, you will need to submit a ticket that lists which application is being requested, and who it’s for. If it’s for faculty and staff, we will likely create an installer and make it visible to all faculty and staff. If it’s for a class, we will limit the installation to users in that program. Please make sure what when you are dealing with a request for Adobe software that you determine who it’s for and what scope they plan to implement it (individual use, class, lab machine, etc). Please be aware: we will not be supporting student requests for licenses. Any software requests for students will need to come from the instructor and be approved through the System Admins.
If you have any questions regarding the process or the license, please let me know. I’d be happy to explain in greater detail. A list of the available Desktop products can be found below. Please feel free to pass this information along to the Helpdesk. I will also add it to a private Solution in FreshService. http://www.adobe.com/creativecloud/catalog/desktop.html Please be aware: Development tools will have limited access. There shouldn't be a need for most administrative departments to be doing development work, so we will limit who will be given access. All apps will be subject to review and approval.

solution-article.title: Continuous Account Lockout
solution-article.description:
Things to check:


any wireless devices the user may have - laptops, phones, tablets. Any traffic coming from any wireless devices will only show the IP address of the RADIUS servers, and will not indicate to use what wireless device is causing the lockout.


Single Sign-On websites: if the user has a open session with msoe.edu, or any of the MSOE websites, have them log out of those sessions and log back in with their new password. Continuous sessions will hold onto the last used password.


Webmail: If webmail is causing the lockout, traffic will only show the IP address from Microsoft Outlook servers, and will not indicate what device is causing the lockout. Have the user log out of webmail and sign back in with their new password.


Home computers and devices: we will not have any visibility to a users home devices, and will only see the IP address of their service provider. These IPs may change over time, and may not indicate the true source of the issue. Have the user check their home devices for any website, webmail, VPN, or other sessions.


Checking the logs for a lockout source is a very time-intensive process, and will not guarantee that the resits it returns will provide a relevant source address. Ultimately, the responsibility of a user credentials is theirs to manage. Provide them with a list of possible sources and recommend they log out from all known devices and systems. They will have far more knowledge of the scope of the devices they use than the Helpdesk or the System Admin will.

Webmail: If webmail is causing the lockout, traffic will only show the IP address from Microsoft Outlook servers, and will not indicate what device is causing the lockout. Have the user log out of webmail and sign back in with their new password.
Home computers and devices: we will not have any visibility to a users home devices, and will only see the IP address of their service provider. These IPs may change over time, and may not indicate the true source of the issue. Have the user check their home devices for any website, webmail, VPN, or other sessions.
Checking the logs for a lockout source is a very time-intensive process, and will not guarantee that the resits it returns will provide a relevant source address. solution-article.title: Global Protect - Installation Issues
solution-article.description:
Issue: You downloaded Global Protect onto the laptop and try to install it. When you run the msi you get the following error:

""This advertised application will not be installed because it might be unsafe. Contact your administrator to change the installation user interface option of the package to basic"

Workaround:

1. Bring up a command prompt.

2. change directory to the location of the file.

3. type in: msiexec /i "GlobalProtect64.msi" /qb

- Note: "GlobalProtect64.msi" should be replaced by the exact filename. For example, the name may be "GlobalProtect64 (1).msi"
solution-article.desc-un-html:
Issue: You downloaded Global Protect onto the laptop and try to install it. When you run the msi you get the following error:
""This advertised application will not be installed because it might be unsafe. Contact your administrator to change the installation user interface option of the package to basic"
Workaround:

2. change directory to the location of the file.
3. type in: msiexec /i "GlobalProtect64.msi" /qb
- Note: "GlobalProtect64.msi" should be replaced by the exact filename. For example, the name may be "GlobalProtect64 (1).msi"

solution-article.title: Kaspersky Application Privilege Control - Changing an Application's Trust Level
solution-article.description:
Kaspersky may block access to system resources such as the microphone if it is unable to determine the trustworthiness of an application.


To change an application's trust level follow these instructions:

  1. Open Kaspersky by double clicking the icon in the system tray



  2. Click on the Settings tab (1), then Application Privilege Control (2) and then Applications (3)


  3. Find the name of the executable of the application that needs to be changed (1). After selecting it click on the group name and change it to "Trusted" (2)
solution-article.desc-un-html:
Kaspersky may block access to system resources such as the microphone if it is unable to determine the trustworthiness of an application.
To change an application's trust level follow these instructions:
Open Kaspersky by double clicking the icon in the system tray
Click on the Settings tab (1), then Application Privilege Control (2) and then Applications (3)
Find the name of the executable of the application that needs to be changed (1). After selecting it click on the group name and change it to "Trusted" (2)

solution-article.title: Requesting an SSL Certificate
solution-article.description:
SSL certificates can be requested at https://cert-manager.com/customer/InCommon/ssl. Below are some basic instructions on how to use it. The full user guide is attached.

  1. On the access code page provide the access code "ssl4raiders" and an msoe.edu email address.
  2. Fill out the "SSL Enrollment" form as required. Please use "InCommon SSL (SHA-2)" or "InCommon Multi Domain SSL (SHA-2)" as the certificate type.
  3. If the SSL certificate should be sent to a non-MSOE email address you can put that address in the "External Requester" field.
  4. After submitting the form the certificate will be send for approval. You should receive the certificate by email within 48 hours.
solution-article.desc-un-html:
SSL certificates can be requested at https://cert-manager.com/customer/InCommon/ssl. Below are some basic instructions on how to use it. The full user guide is attached.
On the access code page provide the access code "ssl4raiders" and an msoe.edu email address. Fill out the "SSL Enrollment" form as required. Please use "InCommon SSL (SHA-2)" or "InCommon Multi Domain SSL (SHA-2)" as the certificate type. If the SSL certificate should be sent to a non-MSOE email address you can put that address in the "External Requester" field. After submitting the form the certificate will be send for approval. You should receive the certificate by email within 48 hours.

solution-article.title: Software Center - 1703 Update Not Listed
solution-article.description:
Possible things to try if the update is not listed:


Test for a trust issue:

Test-ComputerSecureChannel in powershell, should output "True"


Verify the computer is not already on 1703

Run winver


Check C:\Windows\CCM\Logs\WUAHandler.log

If "Failed to Add Update Source for WUAgent of type (2) and id" appears over and over in the log:

  1. Delete C:\Windows\System32\GroupPolicy\Machine\registry.pol
  2. Run gpupdate /force
  3. Run update deploy eval cycle
  4. Wait 10 minutes, updates should start to appear

Run M:\Software Center Install\Check Health

This script will attempt to fix various client problems. After it finishes running force a update deploy eval cycle.
solution-article.desc-un-html:
Possible things to try if the update is not listed:
Test for a trust issue: Test-ComputerSecureChannel in powershell, should output "True"
Verify the computer is not already on 1703 Run winver
Check C:\Windows\CCM\Logs\WUAHandler.log If "Failed to Add Update Source for WUAgent of type (2) and id" appears over and over in the log:
Delete C:\Windows\System32\GroupPolicy\Machine\registry.pol Run gpupdate /force Run update deploy eval cycle Wait 10 minutes, updates should start to appear
Run M:\Software Center Install\Check Health This script will attempt to fix various client problems. After it finishes running force a update deploy eval cycle.

solution-article.title: Webex - Issues with Desktop or Application Sharing
solution-article.description: If there are issues with webex(cwms) sharing desktop or applications on a users computer check to see if windows update 3124001 is installed. As of today we are pushing it and there is no webex patch available. So the fix is to uninstall that windows update. Reboot. Manualy prompt the computer to ask the wsus server for updates. It will find that update. Right click and hide it so it doesn't get installed on that computer at some future time causing issues again.
solution-article.desc-un-html: If there are issues with webex(cwms) sharing desktop or applications on a users computer check to see if windows update 3124001 is installed. As of today we are pushing it and there is no webex patch available. So the fix is to uninstall that windows update. Reboot. Manualy prompt the computer to ask the wsus server for updates. It will find that update. Right click and hide it so it doesn't get installed on that computer at some future time causing issues again.

solution-article.title: SolidWorks - Error: "Could not load SolidWorks DLL: GdtAnalysisSupport.dll."
solution-article.description:
1.     Uninstall SOLIDWORKS from Programs and Features

2.     Click 'Start', click 'Run', type "regedit" in the 'Open' box, and then click 'OK'.

3.     Locate and click the following subkey in the registry: HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\Installer

               Note: If this subkey does not exist, create it.

4.     In the 'Edit' menu, point to 'New', and then click 'DWORD Value'.

5.     For the DWORD name, type "RemappedElevatedProxiesPolicy", and then press 'Enter'.

6.     Right-click "RemappedElevatedProxiesPolicy", and then click 'Modify'.

7.     In the Value data box, type "1", and then click 'OK'.

8.     Install SOLIDWORKS from your Administrative Image

9.     After the application installs successfully, reset the RemappedElevatedProxiesPolicy DWORD value to "0" to re-enable the security fix for KB 3072630.
solution-article.desc-un-html: 1. Uninstall SOLIDWORKS from Programs and Features 2. Click 'Start', click 'Run', type "regedit" in the 'Open' box, and then click 'OK'. 3. Locate and click the following subkey in the registry: HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\Installer Note: If this subkey does not exist, create it. 4. In the 'Edit' menu, point to 'New', and then click 'DWORD Value'. 5. For the DWORD name, type "RemappedElevatedProxiesPolicy", and then press 'Enter'. 6. Right-click "RemappedElevatedProxiesPolicy", and then click 'Modify'. 7. In the Value data box, type "1", and then click 'OK'. 8. Install SOLIDWORKS from your Administrative Image 9. After the application installs successfully, reset the RemappedElevatedProxiesPolicy DWORD value to "0" to re-enable the security fix for KB 3072630.

solution-article.title: SAP2000 License renewal process
solution-article.description:
The SAP200 license is a perpetual license that is located on applicense2. It has a term of 1 year and must be updated manually. To do this login the server, launch the CSI license manager > view all licenses > renew license > check renew > hit ok


If for some reason that doesn't work or we ever need a new version contact CSI sales.

Key: a360325f-

*don't know who bought it



Sysadmin team

Cam Wilson

solution-article.title: Connecting to faculty-web
solution-article.description:
Please use the commands below to get connect to the server.


For users using the putty application

1). enter the hostname faculty-web.msoe.edu into the putty window
2). insure that the software is using ssh on port 22 and click open
3). you will be asked to store the server's key in the catalog, click yes.
4). Please use 'username@ad.msoe.edu' as your login name
5). Use your most up to date account password

For users using the linux/ OSX command line
1). open a terminal shell
2). enter the following command
'ssh username@ad.msoe.edu@faculty-web.msoe.edu'
3). If prompted to add a key, type 'yes'
4). Use your most up to date account password

For using Dreamweaver or similar environments
Server information is the following
address = faculty-web.msoe.edu
username = username@ad.msoe.edu
password = current account password
port = 22

Notes:
- Each user web root directory is at /home/ad.msoe.edu/username/MyWeb
